item.title: Accessing React state in your component cleanup with hooks
item.description: I came across an interesting problem where I needed to access a piece of React state when unmounting a component, a problem that would have been trivial with Class components and componentWillUnmount, however with hooks, the solution was less clear.

item.title: Azure AD Authentication in Cypress Tests with MSAL
item.description: Its been over 2 years since I wrote about this; in that time Microsoft has moved from ADAL to MSAL and so it was a good time to revisit this topic.

item.title: Azure AD Authentication in Cypress Tests
item.description: Cypress is a browser-based, end-to-end testing framework that is enjoyable to use however I ran into some difficulty trying to authenticate with Azure Active Directory in my tests. Find out what I did to fix it!

item.title: Deploying a static site to AWS using GitHub Actions
item.description: I was fortunate enough to get a beta invite to Github Actions earlier this week so I figured I would try to deploy a static website to AWS. I also look at the Actions building blocks and keeping your secrets secret.

item.title: Direct Lambda resolvers with AWS Amplify
item.description: AWS Amplify is fantastic; it has never been easier to build and provision a cloud-based, full-stack, web application. We can easily create an API using AppSync and have it just work but what happens when you need to perform additional logic?

item.title: Just Enough CSS Grid to be dangerous
item.description: CSS Grid is one of my favourite tools for building your web layouts. I examine where we have come from in terms of web layouts and what you need to know to start building your own.

item.title: Managing React application state with Context
item.description: There are many state management libraries available for React but what if I told you that the best way of managing application state is actually built into React.

item.title: Next.js 13 Layouts by Example
item.description: Let's look at how the new Layouts announced at Next.js Conf 2022 improve the developer experience of working with Next.js

item.title: Private NPM modules with GitHub packages
item.description: Learn how to publish to GitHub packages, package scoping, making your packages private and consuming them.

item.title: Publishing TypeScript NPM Modules
item.description: Understanding how to build your own NPM modules can enable your development teams to share common pieces of code across multiple applications.

item.title: Refreshing my blog with Netlify CMS and Tailwind CSS
item.description: It has come time for the annual website redesign and refresh. I discuss why I wanted to refresh my website, what I used to build it and what exciting new features you can expect to see in the coming months.

item.title: Scaffolding your AWS single page application infrastructure with CDK
item.description: I'm finding CDK really enjoyable to pick up and understand. Come find out how to set up your static sites and single page applications using it.

item.title: UPDATED: Deploying a static site to AWS using GitHub Actions
item.description: It has been just under a year since I wrote my initial about deploying static sites to AWS via Github Actions and a number of things have changed since then. I discuss my process for deploying static sites using Github Actions and whats changed since the initial version of the article.
